author: Staff Reporter
text:
Timely intervention of officials led to stopping of a marriage fixed between a Plus Two student and a youth here on Wednesday.

Childline 1098 received tipoff about the proposed marriage that was planned for next month. A team of officials from revenue, police and District Child Protection Unit visited the girl’s house in Erumapatty. Officials came to know that the girl was to be married to a 21-year-old labourer. The girl’s parents were warned of continuing with the proposal and written statement was obtained from them. The girl was produced before the Child Welfare Committee on Wednesday.

- Staff Reporter
title: Minor girl’s marriage stopped
